video.title: TEDTalks: Robotic Machinations
video.synopsis: Take a ride on the silicon side with these speakers whose incredible robotic machinations are redefining what it means to be a machine.

episodes.synopsis: Dennis Hong introduces amazing robots built by his team. What are the five creative secrets to his lab's incredible success?
episodes.title: Dennis Hong: My Seven Species of Robot

episodes.synopsis: Hod Lipson demonstrates his cool little robots, which can learn, understand themselves and even self-replicate.
episodes.title: Hod Lipson Builds Self-Aware Robots

episodes.synopsis: P.W. Singer shows how the use of robots in war is changing the realities of combat.
episodes.title: P.W. Singer on Military Robots and the Future of War

episodes.synopsis: Wondering why we use robots on Mars but not in our living rooms, Cynthia Breazeal builds robots that teach, learn and play.
episodes.title: Cynthia Breazeal: The Rise of Personal Robots

episodes.synopsis: Technology is evolving us, says Amber Case. Will machines ultimately connect or conquer us? Case offers surprising insight.
episodes.title: Amber Case: We Are All Cyborgs Now

episodes.synopsis: Can robots respond to emotion while responding with their own expressions? The Einstein Robot offers a peek into the future.
episodes.title: David Hanson: Robots That Show Emotion

episodes.synopsis: Heather Knight introduces Data, a robotic stand-up comedian that does much more than rattle off one-liners.
episodes.title: Heather Knight: Silicon-Based Comedy

episodes.synopsis: Balancing on a ball, Rezero is the first ballbot made to move quickly and gracefully -- and even dance.
episodes.title: Péter Fankhauser: Meet Rezero, the Dancing Ballbot

episodes.synopsis: Insects and animals have evolved some amazing skills. Robert Full shows how human engineers can learn from animals' tricks.
episodes.title: Robert Full on Engineering and Evolution

episodes.synopsis: Catherine Mohr tours the history of surgery and demonstrates some of the newest tools. Fascinating -- but not for the squeamish.
episodes.title: Catherine Mohr: Surgery's Past, Present and Robotic Future

episodes.synopsis: In this prophetic talk from 2003, roboticist Rodney Brooks talks about how robots are going to work their way into our lives.
episodes.title: Rodney Brooks Says Robots Will Invade Our Lives

episodes.synopsis: A physiatrist demonstrates a prosthetic arm that connects with the nervous system, improving motion and even feeling.
episodes.title: Todd Kuiken: A Prosthetic Arm That Feels

episodes.synopsis: MIT professor Rodney Brooks explains how robots can be used to take on dangerous as well as mundane tasks, freeing up humans for other pursuits.
episodes.title: Rodney Brooks: Why We Will Rely on Robots

episodes.synopsis: Daniel Suarez digs into the consequences of technology that's here to stay: autonomous bots and drones programmed to be lethal.
episodes.title: Daniel Suarez: The Kill Decision Shouldn't Belong to a Robot

episodes.synopsis: Raffaello D'Andrea demos his flying quadcopters: robots that think like athletes, solving physical problems with algorithms that help them learn.
episodes.title: Raffaello D'Andrea: The Astounding Athletic Power of Quadcopters

episodes.synopsis: With humor and humility, trivia whiz Ken Jennings tells us how it felt to have a computer literally beat him at his own game in a challenge match.
episodes.title: Ken Jennings: Watson, Jeopardy and Me, the Obsolete Know-It-All

episodes.synopsis: Vijay Kumar and his team build flying quadrotors, small, agile robots that form ad hoc teams -- for construction, surveying disasters and far more.
episodes.title: Vijay Kumar: Robots That Fly... and Cooperate

episodes.synopsis: Keller Rinaudo demos Romo, the smart phone-powered mini robot that can motor along with you on a walk and react to you with programmable expressions.
episodes.title: Keller Rinaudo: A Mini Robot -- Powered By Your Phone

episodes.synopsis: Bruno Maisonnier of Aldebaran Robotics choreographs a troupe of tiny humanoid Nao robots through a surprisingly emotive performance.
episodes.title: Bruno Maisonnier: Dance, Tiny Robots!
